reviews.review_msg: Amazing prof. Only rarely do you meet a prof willing to listen to your questions, concerns, issues related to completing your assignment with a genuine caring vibe. Always accommodated my problems to help me get the best grade I could achieve.

By far the best prof at Simon Fraser! Caring, understanding, fair, and actually there for you. Took her Edmund Spenser class with not much interest in the subject but she made me love it. DEF RECOMMEND! Can't wait to take another class of hers

I was really surprised by the mark that I got eventually, since I've passioantely hated her and Edmund Spencer and related her passion for this writer with all sorts of nasty attributes. I thought she really dislikes me too for simply disagreeing, but now I think I was wrong. She is very up-front and her seminars are engaging and run full length

Amazing class, amazing professor. Paul did an amazing job highlighting the important aspects of Middleton's work and I think studying Middleton should be mandatory for any English student. Paul was funny and very interested in the material - make sure you read your stuff and contribute to get the best of what he has to offer.

Gavin was a great prof. Very helpful and interesting. However, the class on Thomas Middleton was quite difficult. There is not much supplementary material on Middleton and I found the material quite dry. Considering how dull the material is, Gavin did a great job.

I've been spoiled by this man. Extremely knowledgeable, witty, and charismatic. He puts every other professor I've had to shame. Btw, take a shot every time he utters one of this "catchphrases": -If you haven't seen/read it, do it tonight! -Can you think of any modern examples of this? -How would you stage this? -Great name for a rock band!

Tiffany's classes usually lacked the critical approach I expected for an upper level class. She marked the close reading exercise really hard and the final indeed, was not meant to last 3 hours. On the bright side, her 4 hour classes were not boring. Her frequently used phrase "I don't know" undermined the validity of our answers: how annoying!

Tiffany is an breath of fresh air in a department and subject that occasionally seems at tad stodgy.  Her classes are incredibly well run, with snappy lectures and helpful group work.  I'd take another of her classes in a heart-beat.

Tiffany seems like a new professor that loves her subject but sitting in class is like being in a episode of dawson's creek she always has to tell us the meaning of her words and the readings she chose are horrible! She is not clear on what is important and she doesn't make the subject interesting. She is very boring to listen to.
